## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 904, 292]]<|/det|>
9231/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 301, 367, 316]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 302, 904, 316]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 384, 392, 399]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 880, 636]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 664, 212, 678]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 680, 728, 711]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 96, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 920, 110]]<|/det|>
Find the roots of the equation \(z^{3} = 27 - 27\mathrm{i}\) , giving your answers in the form \(r\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta}\) , where \(r > 0\) and \(-\pi \leqslant \theta < \pi\) . [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 82, 94, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 77, 918, 117]]<|/det|>
By considering the binomial expansion of \(\left(z - \frac{1}{z}\right)^5\) , where \(z = \cos \theta + \mathrm{i}\sin \theta\) , use de Moivre's theorem to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[358, 140, 641, 168]]<|/det|>
\[\cos \mathrm{e}\mathrm{c}^{5}\theta = \frac{a}{\sin 5\theta + b\sin 3\theta + c\sin\theta},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 190, 484, 208]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) , \(b\) and \(c\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 190, 920, 208]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[64, 32, 880, 508]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 517, 918, 555]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = \frac{1}{\sqrt{x}} \mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{x}}\) for \(x \geqslant 1\), together with a set of \(n - 1\) rectangles of unit width.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 568, 148, 586]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 567, 672, 586]]<|/det|>
By considering the sum of the areas of these rectangles, show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[374, 602, 625, 645]]<|/det|>
\[\sum_{r = 1}^{n}\frac{1}{\sqrt{r}}\mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{r}}< \left(2 + \frac{1}{\sqrt{n}}\right)\mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{n}} - 2\mathrm{e}. \quad [5]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[938, 613, 968, 631]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 256, 144, 274]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 250, 730, 287]]<|/det|>
Use a similar method to find, in terms of \(n\), a lower bound for \(\sum_{r=1}^{n} \frac{1}{\sqrt{r}} e^{\sqrt{r}}\). [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 256, 920, 275]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 94, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 544, 90]]<|/det|>
Find the particular solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 110, 594, 144]]<|/det|>
\[6\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}x}{\mathrm{d}t^{2}} +3\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} +6x = \mathrm{e}^{-t},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 160, 400, 187]]<|/det|>
given that, when \(t = 0\) , \(x = \frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} = 0\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 163, 920, 182]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 191, 917, 928]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 70, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 70, 465, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 108, 600, 144]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} -\frac{x + 5}{x^2 + 10x + 61} y = 1,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 163, 630, 182]]<|/det|>
given that \(y = 0\) when \(x = 3\). Give your answer in an exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 163, 920, 182]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 196, 917, 928]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\lambda\) is an eigenvalue of the non-singular square matrix \(\mathbf{A}\), with corresponding eigenvector \(\mathbf{e}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 119, 715, 138]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\mathbf{e}\) is an eigenvector of \(\mathbf{A}^3\) with corresponding eigenvalue \(\lambda^3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 119, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 400, 317, 418]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 425, 576, 482]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \left( \begin{array}{ccc} -1 & 3 & 4 \\ 0 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & -2 & 5 \end{array} \right).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 507, 146, 526]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 507, 532, 526]]<|/det|>
Show that the eigenvalues of \(\mathbf{A}\) are \(-1, 1\) and 5.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 507, 920, 526]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 77, 144, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 76, 688, 96]]<|/det|>
Find a matrix \(\mathbf{P}\) and a diagonal matrix \(\mathbf{D}\) such that \(\mathbf{A} - 2\mathbf{I} = \mathbf{P}\mathbf{D}\mathbf{P}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 77, 920, 96]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 106, 917, 565]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 572, 148, 591]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 572, 920, 607]]<|/det|>
Use the characteristic equation of \(\mathbf{A}\) to show that \(\left(\mathbf{A} - 2\mathbf{I}\right)^3 = a\mathbf{A}^2 + b\mathbf{A} + c\mathbf{I}\) where \(a\) , \(b\) and \(c\) are constants to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[893, 587, 920, 607]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]
